name: Somalia
currentCrisisSummary:
Somalia endures converging **structural crises**: protracted civil war stemming from **state collapse** induced by **Cold War** legacies and **neoliberal policies**; an entrenched al-Shabaab insurgency born from failed '**War on Terror**' interventions; deep **political fragmentation** rooted in **clan dynamics** and regional tensions (Somaliland, Puntland); and **climate catastrophe** devastating livelihoods.

These dynamicsâ€”amplified by **geopolitical competition** (Gulf States, Turkey), **external military interference** (AU mission, drone strikes), and **predatory extraction** (illegal fishing)â€”produce chronic suffering. Millions are displaced, services disintegrated, and mass hunger recurs.

colonialRoot.legacy:
The crisis is rooted in the **colonial partitioning** during the **Scramble for Africa**. Britain, Italy (and France) divided a cohesive people with **artificial borders**, disrupting traditional systems and creating distinct administrative legacies (e.g., Somaliland vs. Southern Somalia).

The rushed post-colonial merger left unresolved tensions over power-sharing and regional autonomy, compounded by **Cold War geopolitics** and frequent **external interventions**.

historicalContext.title: Neoliberalism and State Collapse
historicalContext.description: The 1991 **state collapse** was preceded by economic crisis and **neoliberal intervention**. In the 1980s, the indebted Barre regime accepted **IMF-led Structural Adjustment Programmes (SAPs)**. These enforced **deregulation**, destroying farmers' livelihoods. Mandated **austerity** **hollowed out the state's** capacity, accelerating social breakdown.

historicalContext.title: Internal Fragmentation: Clan, Regions, and Federalism
historicalContext.description: **State collapse** allowed pre-existing **clan identities** to become the primary basis for political mobilisation and conflict. This led to the *de facto* independence of **Somaliland** (1991) and the autonomy of **Puntland** (1998). The internationally-backed **Federal Government (FGS)** struggles for legitimacy against powerful **Federal Member States (FMS)**, often fuelled by competing **clan interests** and external patrons.

historicalContext.title: The War on Terror and the Rise of Al-Shabaab
historicalContext.description: The post-9/11 '**Global War on Terror**' framework drove conflict. The 2006 **US-backed Ethiopian invasion** ousted the Islamic Courts Union (ICU), shattered stability, and catalysed al-Shabaab's rise (**blowback**). Decades of **drone strikes**, **special forces operations**, and **proxy interventions** entrenched violence, undermining reconciliation.

historicalContext.title: AMISOM/ATMIS: Intervention and Complicity
historicalContext.description: The dominant security actor since 2007 has been the **AU Mission (AMISOM/ATMIS)**, largely funded by the West. While preventing total state collapse, this massive military intervention (primarily by neighbouring states) has been criticised for **civilian casualties**, **sexual exploitation**, propping up weak governments, failing to defeat al-Shabaab, and becoming part of the **external interference** landscape.

historicalContext.title: Geopolitical Chessboard: Gulf States & Turkey
historicalContext.description: Somalia is a key arena for **geopolitical competition** between **Gulf states (UAE, Qatar)** and **Turkey**. These powers funnel funds, arms, and training to competing Somali factions and security forces, pursuing strategic interests (ports, resources, ideology) and exacerbating **internal fragmentation**.

historicalContext.title: Climate Change and Economic Exploitation
historicalContext.description: Somalia is on the frontline of **climate change**: droughts/floods destroy livelihoods. **State collapse** enabled illicit activity: **illegal fishing** by foreign fleets and **toxic-waste dumping** eroded coastal livelihoods. New resource competition risks conflict. These drivers create **ecological and economic injustice**: the Global North's emissions and commercial practices impose heavy costs.

humanitarianImpact.title: Casualties
humanitarianImpact.description: Hundreds of thousands killed by direct conflict, **clan warfare**, and recurring **famines** (e.g., ~258k excess deaths in 2011) driven by war, **state collapse**, and **climate shocks**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Roughly 7 million require aid due to devastation from war, **climate catastrophe**, **political fragmentation**, and **economic predation**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: About 4.4 million face acute hunger from **conflict**, **climate change**, and **economic collapse**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement
humanitarianImpact.description: About 3.5 million internally displaced by **conflict**, **clan violence**, and **extreme weather events** linked to **global warming**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugees
humanitarianImpact.description: Approx. 714,000 refugees driven abroad by chronic violence and lack of basic means.

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Health system decimated by decades of conflict and **state failure**.

timeline.event: **Colonial Partition**: The British, Italian, and French empires carve up Somali-inhabited lands during the Scramble for Africa, creating artificial borders and political fragmentation.
**Independence & Unification**: Former British (Somaliland) and Italian territories unite to form the Somali Republic, but tensions over power-sharing persist.
**Siad Barre's Coup**: General Siad Barre seizes power, later aligning with the USSR; subsequent policies centralise power and sow grievances, particularly among non-Darod clans.
**Ogaden War**: Somalia's intervention in Ethiopia ends in military defeat and shifts Cold War alignments, accelerating militarisation.

**Structural Adjustment**: The indebted Barre regime accepts IMF-led austerity programmes. The deregulation of agriculture destroys rural livelihoods and deepens the economic crisis that precedes state collapse.
**State Collapse & Somaliland Independence**: Barre's overthrow precipitates state collapse and civil war along clan lines. The former British Somaliland declares independence (unrecognised).
**International Intervention**: A US-led, UN-mandated humanitarian intervention ('Operation Restore Hope') withdraws after the 1993 Battle of Mogadishu.

**US-Backed Invasion & Rise of Al-Shabaab**: A US-backed Ethiopian invasion ousts the Islamic Courts Union (ICU) government in Mogadishu. The intervention shatters stability and directly leads to the rise of al-Shabaab.

**AMISOM/ATMIS Intervention**: The African Union deploys a large peacekeeping force (AMISOM, later ATMIS), funded internationally, becoming the main security actor battling al-Shabaab but also facing criticism for abuses and ineffectiveness.
**Famine & Drought**: A catastrophic famine causes massive loss of life (~258,000 excess deaths), highlighting the deadly convergence of conflict, climate change, and state failure.
**Gulf/Turkey Rivalry Intensifies**: Geopolitical competition between the UAE/Saudi Arabia bloc and the Qatar/Turkey bloc spills into Somalia, funding rival political factions and security forces.
**Climate Extremes & Renewed Crisis**: Repeated failed rainy seasons, severe drought followed by floods, and funding shortfalls drive renewed waves of displacement and acute food and nutrition needs.

donate.description: A Somali-led humanitarian and development organisation delivering cash, water and sanitation support and locally led resilience programmes.

advocacy.title: Fund Local Climate Adaptation & Aid
advocacy.description: Push for increased, flexible climate finance and humanitarian funding that is channelled directly to Somali-led organisations and community networks.

advocacy.title: End Economic & Ecological Predation
advocacy.description: Demand accountability for illegal fishing and toxic-waste dumping, and support coastal communities' rights to their marine resources.

advocacy.title: Shift from 'War on Terror' to Politics
advocacy.description: Advocate for a shift from predominately militarised counter-terror strategies to Somali-led political processes addressing **clan and regional grievances**, inclusive governance, and investment in resilient livelihoods.

advocacy.title: Demand Accountability for External Actors
advocacy.description: Support investigations and accountability for abuses committed by all external forces, including **AMISOM/ATMIS** personnel and actors involved in **drone strikes**.

reading.title: *Making Sense of Somali History: Volume 1*
reading.description: Abdurahman Abdullahi (Baadiyow) offers a scholarly account of Somali history across pre-colonial, colonial and post-colonial periods from a Somali perspective.

reading.title: *Dirty Wars: The World Is a Battlefield*
reading.description: Jeremy Scahill's critical investigation into the US 'War on Terror', detailing its disastrous interventions and consequences in Somalia.

reading.title: *The Fate of Africa: A History of Fifty Years of Independence*
reading.description: Martin Meredith provides essential context on post-colonial state failure across Africa, including the dynamics leading to Somalia's collapse.
